channel.title: Updating Skill Capes
channel.description:
Was just wondering, where would I go to make the skill capes only wearable at 150 skill level (new max).
They work at 99, but I want to increase the capes so only the true maxed out players has them.

item.title: Updating Skill Capes
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Please nnote : remove them from shops.

if (playerLevel[14] >= 150) { addItem(id, amount); addItem(id, amount); addItem(id, amount); sendMessage( "Congratulations, you just recived the w/e u want"); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " has just gotten " + playerLevel[14] + "w/e"); }

Im going to explain this to you now.

the if is a lowercase i belive so dont use highercase for it.

Basically

if (something = true){ sendmessage("something is true"); {

Now look at that then this.

if (playerLevel[14] >= 150) { addItem(id, amount); addItem(id, amount); addItem(id, amount); sendMessage( "Congratulations, you just recived the w/e u want"); PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " has just gotten " + playerLevel[14] + "w/e"); }

Each skill has a number like if (playerLevel[idforskill] >= 150) { saying if that skill which 14 is mining is greater than 150 (>) then it will add the item what you put in.

p.s: dont insert it like this…

if (something = true){Sendmessage("something is true");{

Thats bad conventions

insert it like this

if (something = true){ sendmessage("something is true"); {

Hope this helped.

And if ( is called a if statement.

Althought ile explain a if statement is false

if (something = false){ sendmessage("you cant the if is false"): {

there and remove them from shops…

Read full topic
